ygData.subject: Re: mixing bowls
ygData.msgSnippet: ... I feel your pain --- the same thing happened to me when I first got into pottery using jars.  Here s what I ended up doing. Put the unfinished bowls into
ygData.messageBody:
At 07:13 AM 07/23/1999 PDT, you wrote:
>From: "Brandon Purrington" <mbmcenterprises@...>
>
>Ok, I love this list!! I just have one question...
>I have a 120 currently in pottery and have tried to make mixing bowls. I
>made them with no problems, but having 7 backpacks on me for materials, when
>i successfully fired the bowl, it droped to the ground because a container
>can't be stored in another container..... now, how in the world are you
>doing this efficiently? As it is, I have a better/faster time making pie
>tins..... any help would be greatly appreciated!!

I feel your pain --- the same thing happened to me when I first got into
pottery using jars. Here's what I ended up doing.

Put the unfinished bowls into backpacks. It's not a container until after
you've fired it in a kiln. Get another backpack full of firing sheets.
Put everything else into the bank, and just carry a backpack of unfinished
bowls and a backpack of firing sheets. Fire bowls until you fill up your
remaining inventory, and then go sell. Repeat as required.

-Pennaggolan, Baker, Brewer, Potter - who does the occasional bit of
wizard-work on the side.
